description.narrative: In 2015 the project support will help chart out ”hidden potential” in companies where the union does not yet have exact numbers of workers. A basic leaflet of the union will be produced, 20 organizers trained and with the help of these around 2 000 new members recruited. Internal communication and external visibility of the organization will be improved through an information bulletin, basic rights awareness campaign and media relations. Towards the end of the year there will be a meeting to review the pilot and also to plan a longer-term continuation project, if the first trial period gives possibilities for that. This project also includes an element of south-south-north exchange where alongside SINTIAB participate the Mozambican tourism sector union S INTIHOTS, the Ghanaian union organizing in food industry and hospitality / tourism ICU and the Finnish SEL and PAM.The basic structures of the food industry union are in order and it is a recognized negotiation partner in its sector, but its institutional capacity is not yet adequate for efficient interest representation, member services or advocacy work, especially with the rather rapid growth of the sector. Membership growth, knowhow development and improved visibility are at this first stage the expected impacts with which the project support strengthens the defense of workers’ rights in the changing business environment.As results of the pilot year improved organizing skills and membership growth by around 2 000 people are expected, as well as increase d rights awareness among workers and improved visibility of the union in various parts of the country. The pilot also forms a basis for development of a long-term cooperation partnership, aiming at a result-oriented institutional strengthening and more ac tive participation of members in the union action. Through the exchange program of three countries the union gains new types information from experiences of others and ideas for further development of its activities.Beneficiaries of the work will be Mozamb ican food industry workers.Food industry workers’ union of Mozambique SINTIAB is the largest union of its country covering food and beverage sectors, and its members are workers of mills and other grain processing plants, dairies, canning factories, cook ing oil factories and beverage industry. SINTIAB is an affiliate of the national centre OTM-CS and at international level it belongs to the IUF.
